data.title: Breaking Down Roboflow's Health Check Dimension Insights
data.description: Roboflow improves datasets without any user effort. This includes dropping zero-pixel bounding boxes and cropping out-of-frame bounding boxes to be in-line with the edge of an image. data.title: Introducing the Roboflow Model Library
data.description: Over the past few months we've been building up a library of easy to use, open source computer vision models. data.title: Introducing an Improved Hard Hat Dataset for Computer Vision in Workplace Safety
data.description: In a given year, approximately 65,000 workers wearing hard hats incur head injuries in the workplace, of which over one thousand ultimately die. data.title: Using Computer Vision to Fight Coronavirus (COVID-19)

data.title: Releasing a New YOLOv3 Implementation in PyTorch

data.title: Introducing Image Preprocessing and Augmentation Previews
data.description: Knowing how an image preprocessing step or augmentation is going to appear before you write the code for it is essential. Is it worth it to figure out the right amount of brightness? Will rotation increase variability appropriately? Roboflow is introducing features to take out the guesswork: preprocessing and augmentation

data.title: How Flip Augmentation Improves Model Performance
data.description: Flipping an image (and its annotations) is a deceivingly simple technique that can improve model performance in substantial ways. Our models are learning what collection of pixels and the relationship between those collections of pixels denote an object is in-frame. data.title: Introducing Bounding Box Level Augmentations
data.description: This state of the art technique has been shown to improve model performance. Roboflow is the only online platform to offer it.

data.title: The Importance of Blur as an Image Augmentation Technique

data.title: How to Select the Right Computer Vision Model Architecture
